item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "The compelling thing about making art - or making anything, I suppose - is the moment when the vaporous, insubstantial idea becomes a solid there, a thing, a substance in a world of substances." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Right now we are here, and nothing can mar our perfection, or steal the joy of this perfect moment." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?" -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "I feel guilty for wanting to avoid the sadness, dead people need us to rememer them, even if it eats us, even if all we can do is say “I am sorry”, until its as meaningless as air." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "When did the future switch from being a promise to being a threat?" -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Today is the sort of day where the sun only comes up to humiliate you." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The only difference between a suicide and a martyrdom really is the amount of press coverage." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention. Well, get used to that feeling. That's how your whole life will feel some day. This is all practice." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?" -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "No matter how much you think you love somebody, you'll step back when the pool of their blood edges up too close." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by chuck palahniuk
item.description: "Until you find something to fight for, you settle for something to fight against." -- chuck palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "I admire addicts. In a world where everybody is waiting for some blind, random disaster or some sudden disease, the addict has the comfort of knowing what will most likely wait for him down the road. He's taken some control over his ultimate fate, and his addiction keeps the cause of his death from being a total surprise." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?" "Well, sweetheart," I tell her, "yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Just for the record, the weather today is calm and sunny, but the air is full of bullshit." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Hysteria is impossible without an audience. Panicking by yourself is the same as laughing alone in an empty room. You feel really silly." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Give me lust, baby. Flash. Give me malice. Flash. Give me detached existentialist ennui. Flash. Give me rampant intellectualism as a coping mechanism. Flash." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "We'll be remembered more for what we destroy than what we create." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Your heart is my piñata." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Just for the record, the weather today is bitter with occasional fits of jealous rage." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "When you understand, that what you're telling is just a story. It isn't happening anymore. When you realize the story you're telling is just words, when you can just crumble up and throw your past in the trashcan, then we'll figure out who you're going to be." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "No, whether a woman is a concubine to fuck or a damsel to redeem, she's always just some passive object to fulfill a man's purpose." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "When you think about it, Johnny Appleseed was a fucking ecological terrorist." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description:
"Listen, now, you're going to die, Ray-mond K. K. K. Hessel, tonight. You might die in one second or in one hour, you decide. So lie to me. Tell me the first thing off the top of your head. Make something up. I don't give a shit. I have a gun.
Finally, you were listening and coming out of the little tragedy in your head.
Fill in the blank. What does Raymond Hessel want to be when he grows up?
Go home, you said you just wanted to go home, please.
No shit, I said. But after that, how did you want to spend your life? If you could do anything in the world.
Make something up.
You didn't know.
Then you're dead right now, I said. I said, now turn your head.
Death to commence in ten, in nine, in eight.
A vet, you said. You want to be a vet, a veterinarian.
You could be in school working your ass off, Raymond Hessel, or you could be dead. You choose. I stuffed your wallet into the back of your jeans. So you really wanted to be an animal doctor. I took the saltwater muzzle of the gun off one cheek and pressed it against another. Is that what you've always wanted to be, Dr. Raymond K. K. K. K. Hessel, a veterinarian?...
So, I said, go back to school. If you wake up tomorrow morning, you find a way to get back into school.
I have your license.
I know who you are. I know where you live. I'm keeping your license, and I'm going to check on you, mister Raymond K. Hessel. In three months, and then six months, and then a year, and if you aren't back in school on your way to being a veterinarian, you will be dead...
Raymond K. K. Hessel, your dinner is going to taste better than any meal you've ever eaten, and tomorrow will be the most beautiful day of your life." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "People have to really suffer before they can risk doing what they love." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn
item.description: "Own only what you can always carry with you: know languages, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag." -- Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn
item.description: "A man is happy so long as he chooses to be happy." -- Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn
item.description: "And how we burned in the camps later, thinking: What would things have been like if every Security operative, when he went out at night to make an arrest, had been uncertain whether he would return alive and had to say good-bye to his family? Or if, during periods of mass arrests, as for example in Leningrad, when they arrested a quarter of the entire city, people had not simply sat there in their lairs, paling with terror at every bang of the downstairs door and at every step on the staircase, but had understood they had nothing left to lose and had boldly set up in the downstairs hall an ambush of half a dozen people with axes, hammers, pokers, or whatever else was at hand?... The Organs would very quickly have suffered a shortage of officers and transport and, notwithstanding all of Stalin's thirst, the cursed machine would have ground to a halt! If...if...We didn't love freedom enough. And even more – we had no awareness of the real situation.... We purely and simply deserved everything that happened afterward." -- Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Billy Collins
item.description: "A motto I've adopted is, if at first you don't succeed, hide all evidence that you ever tried." -- Billy Collins

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Billy Collins
item.description: "All they want to do is tie the poem to a chair with a rope and torture a confession out of it. They begin beating it with a hose to find out what it really means." -- Billy Collins
